column4: I know for a fact my /home partition is 15 GB, and I am the only user on this computer, and when I go to the properties of my home directory in nautilus it's only at 300 MB, but I'm getting 14 GB is used with df -h on the command line. Any ideas what else takes up space on /home?
you can check on space by (in a terminal window): du -ba | sort -n
that should tell you what is taking up the space.
i'll check that out now, didn't know those commands
do you have nautilus set to show the hidden files?
wouldn't that still show up in used space? I'll double check
du will show you all files and folders and the space they use.
turn on the hidden files option in nautilus to see ALL the files.
did that it's still showing only 300 MB
did which?
i just did it in nautilus, i'm checking du now
you can limit the depth of the tree du searches like this: du -ba --max-depth=1 | sort -n
it depends, du -b does
-ba says, show in bytes and all files (not just directories).
ActionParsnip, ah, thanks guys, I found it
sort will order them so the largest is last.
good you found it.
ActionParsnip, how do you guys remember all the little utilities to do stuff like this?
work more on the command line than in the gui
ActionParsnip, maco, thanks guys for your help
you're welcome
